title: CrossFuse: Learning Infrared and Visible Image Fusion by Cross-Sensor Top-K Vision Alignment and Beyond
author: Yukai Shi (Guangdong University of Technology), Cidan Shi (Guangdong University of Technology), Zhipeng Weng (Guangdong University of Technology), Yin Tian (CRRC Academy Co., Ltd.), Xiaoyu Xian (CRRC Academy Co., Ltd.), Liang Lin (Sun Yat-sen University), Fellow, IEEE
relevance_why: The proposed multi-view data augmentation and feature extraction techniques could be adapted for audio-visual integration tasks, particularly in generating high-fidelity audio using visual input.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of fusing infrared and visible images in real-world conditions where the data collected can drastically differ from the training data.
contribution: CrossFuse introduces a multi-view data augmentation framework utilizing Top-K selective channel alignment and self-supervised learning strategies to enhance the robustness of infrared-visible image fusion.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically struggled in out-of-distribution scenarios due to direct reliance on training datasets that do not reflect real-world variations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances model adaptability and generalization to real-world inputs by incorporating external and internal data augmentations, ensuring better performance even in challenging conditions.

key_innovation: The combination of external view data augmentation with selective channel alignment and internal self-supervised learning helps generate more consistent feature representations.
real_world_impact: Successful implementation of this method could improve safety and reliability in critical applications like autonomous driving and surveillance, where image quality and clarity are crucial.
limitations: Performance may degrade under extreme distribution shifts between training and test data.

new_terms.Top-K Selective Channel Alignment: **Top-K Selective Channel Alignment** is an approach that modifies external image data using gamma transformations, optimizing data distribution consistency between various datasets to enhance model training.
new_terms.Weak-Aggressive Augmentation: **Weak-Aggressive Augmentation** refers to a dual-approach in data augmentation where initial weak transformations are applied followed by more aggressive ones to generate diverse yet coherent training examples.
